# Aufgabe

Zählen Sie fehlende Werte im Datensatz `penguins` *zeilenweise*.

# Lösung

## Setup


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
library(tidyverse)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr}

```{.r .cell-code}
d_path <- "https://vincentarelbundock.github.io/Rdatasets/csv/palmerpenguins/penguins.csv"
d <- read_csv(d_path)
```

## Weg 1


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
apply(d, 1, function(x) sum(is.na(x)))
```

## Weg 2


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
d_na_only <- 
  d %>% 
  rowwise() %>% 
  mutate(na_n = sum(is.na(cur_data()))) %>% 
  ungroup()
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr}
```
Warning: There was 1 warning in `mutate()`.
ℹ In argument: `na_n = sum(is.na(cur_data()))`.
ℹ In row 1.
Caused by warning:
! `cur_data()` was deprecated in dplyr 1.1.0.
ℹ Please use `pick()` instead.
```
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
d_na_only %>% 
  pull(na_n)
```


## Weg 3



::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
d_na_only <- 
  d %>% 
  mutate(na_n = rowSums(is.na(.)))
 

d_na_only %>% 
  pull(na_n)
```

# Weg 4

Der folgende Weg funktioniert nur, wenn alle Variablen vom Typ `numeric` sind.





::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
d %>% 
  rowwise() %>% 
  mutate(na_n = sum(is.na(c_across(everything()))))
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-error}
```
Error in `mutate()`:
ℹ In argument: `na_n = sum(is.na(c_across(everything())))`.
ℹ In row 1.
Caused by error in `vec_c()`:
! Can't combine `...1` <double> and `species` <character>.
```
:::
:::
